meanings.definition: (adjective) Having been aged in oak barrels.
meanings.sent1: The oaked wine had a rich flavor from the oak barrels.
meanings.sent2: The oaked whiskey had a hint of vanilla from the oak aging process.
meanings.sent3: The oaked cheese was so flavorful, it danced on my taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The oaked scent of the forest filled the room, transporting me to the woods.
meanings.sent5: The oaked aroma lingered in the air, inviting me to take a sip.

meanings.definition: (verb) The past tense of the verb 'oak', meaning to age in oak barrels.
meanings.sent1: They oaked the wine to enhance its flavor profile.
meanings.sent2: The distillery oaked the spirits for a smoother taste.
meanings.sent3: He oaked the sauce with care, creating a masterpiece in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The chef oaked the dish, infusing it with a smoky essence.
meanings.sent5: She oaked the ingredients, adding depth to the recipe.
